Otherwise, my bullet is there for you (sukh chain ki zindagi jio, roti khao. Varna meri goli to hai hee),‚Äù the Prime Minister asserted in the direct message to those across the border

content: The police said that there had been ‚Äòno legal claimant‚Äô for the seven bodies, including that of top Maoist leader Basavaraju

title: Mumbai breaks record, receives highest rainfall in May

title: Kerala govt. to crack down on teachers, staff involved in POCSO cases: Minister
content: 77 POCSO cases reported so far against those working in secondary schools. 3 POCSO cases reported in vocational higher secondary division

title: Bar district administration, civic volunteers from Bengal poll process: BJP
content: Suvendu Adhikari said that fair elections are a prerequisite to democracy in West Bengal and urged the Chief Electoral Officer to change the Standard Operating Procedure

title: Video Shows Moment Car Ploughs Liverpool Football Club Victory Parade
content: A car ploughed into a packed crowd celebrating Liverpool's Premier League title victory on Monday, injuring nearly 50 people, including four children.

title: What Saudi Arabia Official Said On Reports Of Kingdom Lifting Alcohol Ban
content: A Saudi official denied on Monday media reports saying the kingdom, the birthplace of Islam, would lift its 73-year-old ban on alcohol, which is prohibited for observant Muslims.

title: Turkey's Erdogan Congratulates Pak Field Marshal Asim Munir
content: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan warmly greeted Pakistan's new Field Marshal Asim Munir and congratulated him on his promotion in the wake of the religiously-motivated Pahalgam terror attack in which 26 tourists were killed in India.

title: On Camera, Odisha Journalist Thrashed For Trying To Report On Corruption
content: Bijay Pradhan was tied and beaten up in public on Saturday, and four persons, including a minor, were arrested after a video of the assault went viral.

title: 27 In Hospital As Car Hits Liverpool Fans, Cops Rule Out Terrorism
content: A car ploughed into a crowd of Liverpool fans during a parade celebrating their side's Premier League soccer title on Monday, hospitalising 27 people, with two seriously injured, but police said they did not believe the incident was terrorism-related

title: Karnataka Lawyer Invests In "Trump Hotel Rental Scheme", Loses Lakhs
content: A 38-year-old advocate was duped by cybercriminals who allegedly lured him into investing in a Trump Hotel rentals scheme using an AI-generated video of US President Donald Trump promising high returns, police said on Monday.

title: Karnataka BJP Leader N Ravikumar Calls Official 'Pakistani', Police Case Filed
content: A major political controversy erupted in Karnataka after the BJP's Member of Legislative Council N Ravikumar made a communal remark against Kalaburagi Deputy Commissioner Fouzia Taranum, a Muslim IAS officer.

title: PM Modi's "Bullet" Warning To Pakistan: "Roti Khao, Varna..."
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a warning to Pakistan today, reaching out directly to its people. Only the people of Pakistan, he said, can cure it of the disease of terrorism.

title: "Have No Fear": Trump Vows To 'Win' Against Harvard, Threatens Funding
content: US President Donald Trump vowed Monday to prevail in his clash with Harvard and again threatened to take away billions in funding from one of the world's top universities.

title: Won't Differentiate Between Terrorists, Backers: Indian Delegation In France
content: The series of engagements of the all-party delegation led by BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad, which is visiting France from May 25-27 to convey India's strong stance against terrorism, was shared by the Embassy of India in France.

title: Kutch Major Centre Of Trade, Tourism, Commerce: PM Modi In Gujarat
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said Kutch is a major hub for trade, commerce, and tourism and that the region's role will expand further in the coming years.

title: Pak Will Be Wiped Out If It Continues To Nurture Terrorists: J&K Lt Governor
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Monday reiterated India's warning that if Pakistan continues to nurture terrorists in its backyard, its existence could be wiped out.

title: "Will No Longer Succumb To Nuclear Blackmail": BJP's Jay Panda In Kuwait
content: BJP MP Baijayant Panda, leading an all-party delegation to Kuwait, asserted that India will no longer remain silent in the face of terrorism from Pakistan and will respond strongly.

title: Supriya Sule-Led All-Party Delegation Concludes Qatar Visit
content: The all-party delegation led by NCP-SCP MP Supriya Sule concluded their visit to Qatar, which was the first country in the leg of the four-nation visit of the delegation planned following the dastardly Pahalgam terror attacks and Operation Sindoor.

title: Ukraine Says Russian Forces Capture 4 Villages As War Intensifies
content: The governor of Ukraine's Sumy region on the Russian border said on Monday that Russian forces had captured four villages as part of an attempt to create a "buffer zone" on Ukrainian territory.

title: North Korea Says US Golden Dome Plan Is "Nuclear War Scenario"
content: North Korea's foreign ministry has criticised the U.S. Golden Dome missile defense shield project as a "very dangerous threatening initiative", state media said on Tuesday.

title: 6 Killed As Truck Runs Over Them In Maharashtra: Cops
content: A truck ran over six people who were removing a crashed vehicle from the road in Beed district of Maharashtra on Monday, officials said.

title: Video: 3 Men Made To Sit On Road As Andhra Cops Hit Them With Sticks
content: Three men, with their legs at full stretch, are made to sit in the middle of the road on Tenali highway in Andhra Pradesh. Scores of policemen surround them. The cops beat them up publicly to teach the men a lesson.

title: Putin Threatens To "Throttle" Western Firms Remaining In Russia
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday threatened to "throttle" Western firms remaining in Russia and acting against its interests, as part of Moscow's effort to beef up domestic software development.

title: Man, 2 Sons' Skulls Crushed, Bodies Found Locked Up At UP Workshop
content: A 58-year-old man and his two sons were hacked to death by some unidentified attackers in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur district, police said on Monday.

title: Thunder take 3-1 lead as SGA drops 40 on Wolves
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander had 40 points and 10 rebounds in a steely performance befitting the NBA MVP, and the Oklahoma City Thunder snapped back from a 42-point loss by edging the Minnesota Timberwolves 128-126 in Game 4 Monday, taking a 3-1 series lead.

title: Dodgers' Ohtani hits 2nd leadoff homer in 2 days
content: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani, the reigning NL MVP, hit a leadoff homer in consecutive games for the second time in his career, going deep against Cleveland's Gavin Williams for his 19th long ball of the season in his club's 7-2 win Monday.

content: The Raiders and All-Pro punter AJ Cole have agreed to a four-year, $15.8 million contract extension with $11 million guaranteed, sources confirmed to ESPN.

content: Cristiano Ronaldo hinted at a potential departure from Al Nassr after scoring in the Saudi Pro League's season finale on Monday, declaring his 'chapter is over' in a social media post.

content: Rangers starter Jacob deGrom, playing in his 229th game Monday against the Blue Jays, failed to record a strikeout for the first time in his major league career.

content: On Sunday, McLaren tried to win two races 4,500 miles apart: F1's Monaco GP and IndyCar's Indianapolis 500.

content: After three titles and 15 wins, √Ålex Palou felt incomplete. Now an Indy 500 winner, that's no longer the case.

content: Man United have agreed the framework of a deal for Liam Delap, sources have told ESPN, and are now waiting for him to decide on his next move.

title: Barcelona sneak into Pot 1 for UCL draw again
content: Barcelona will be in Pot 1 of seeds for the league phase draw of the 2025-26 UEFA Champions League (UCL), and for the second successive season it's because Roma missed out on the final day.

title: Neymar out of Ancelotti's first Brazil squad
content: Carlo Ancelotti has left Neymar out from his first squad selection and has brought back Casemiro, Richarlison and Antony for the upcoming World Cup qualifiers.

content: Former Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has been confirmed as the new manager of Bundesliga side Bayer Leverkusen, replacing Xabi Alonso.

content: Aston Villa confirmed they have made a complaint to the PGMOL about the selection of "inexperienced" referee Thomas Bramall after a costly decision to rule out a Morgan Rogers' goal.

content: Argentina's Mac Allister brothers Alexis and Kevin pulled off an unusual family feat on Sunday by lifting championship trophies on the same afternoon in different countries.

content: Chelsea and Manchester United are waiting for Liam Delap to decide who he wants to play for. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Monsoon sets in over Bengaluru¬†
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Watch: Terrifying moment when a car barreled through Liverpool parade crowd, nearly 50 injured
content: A 53-year-old man was arrested after driving a minivan into a crowd celebrating Liverpool's Premier League victory in England on Monday, May 26, 2025. The incident injured 47 people, including four children, with some requiring hospitalization. Authorities believe it was an isolated event and are not treating it as terrorism, despite the driver's actions during the parade.

title: 'Nakal karne ke liye akal chahiye': Owaisi mocks Pak over fake 'Op Bunyan' pic
content: Asaduddin Owaisi mocked Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif and army chief Asim Munir for displaying a fake image of a Chinese military drill as their own victory over India. He advised the Indian diaspora in Kuwait to disregard Pakistan's claims entirely, emphasizing their lack of intelligence in even attempting to copy others. This follows the viral circulation of the misleading photo.

title: Seven members of Dehradun family found dead in a car; suicide pact suspected
content: In a distressing incident, a family of seven from Dehradun was found dead in a car in Panchkula, suspected to be a suicide pact. Preliminary investigations suggest heavy debt drove the family, including Praveen Mittal, his parents, wife, and three children, to take this extreme step.

title: IPL: How Rohit Sharma's poor form with the bat is hurting MI's campaign
content: Mumbai Indians' IPL 2025 top-two hopes crashed after a loss to Punjab Kings, spotlighting Rohit Sharma's inconsistent form. Despite a few impactful innings, his overall performance has been underwhelming, averaging 27.42 with 329 runs. His struggles have hurt MI's top-order stability, especially during their early-season losses. As MI head into the Eliminator, Rohit's performance is crucial for their title aspirations.

title: 'Hand of Kremlin?': Russian official mocks Macron‚Äôs awkward moment with wife
content: Maria Zakharova, Russia's foreign ministry spokeswoman, ridiculed a video of Emmanuel Macron and his wife in Hanoi, suggesting a marital dispute. Macron dismissed the claims as a joke, but the incident sparked a reaction from the Elysee Palace.

title: Trump to Apple: Okay, you go to India but you're not going to sell in America without ...
content: President Trump is pushing Apple to manufacture iPhones in the United States, threatening a 25% tariff on imported products if they continue production in India. Trump expressed his desire for Apple to prioritize domestic manufacturing, even though India has offered tariff-free deals.

title: Rahul Gandhi, Kharge pay tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru on his death anniversary
content: On Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's 61st death anniversary, Rahul Gandhi honored his great-grandfather, acknowledging his pivotal role in establishing a robust foundation for independent India. Gandhi highlighted Nehru's visionary leadership and invaluable contributions to social justice, modernity, education, the constitution, and democracy. Mallikarjun Kharge also paid tribute to Nehru.

title: Mumbai reels under earliest ever arrival of monsoon, wettest May in 100 years
content: Mumbai experienced its earliest monsoon onset ever recorded, breaking a century-old rainfall record for May with 295mm. The city received very heavy rainfall, with Colaba recording 144.3 mm and Santacruz 74.3 mm. The intense showers exposed the city's unpreparedness, leading to waterlogging in new areas, disrupted train and flight services, and incidents of structural damage.

title: 'We treat Yuzvendra Chahal and the team bus driver with the same respect'
content: Punjab Kings' Shashank Singh lauded coach Ricky Ponting and captain Shreyas Iyer for fostering a culture of equality and mutual respect within the team. He emphasized that Ponting's coaching has transformed the team's mindset and belief, while Iyer's leadership provides freedom to every member, including support staff.

title: Mark Cuban on why he does not drive his Tesla, but much cheaper Kia EV6
content: Mark Cuban prefers his Kia EV6 over his Tesla, citing user-friendliness, particularly the traditional turn signal design. Despite his preference, Cuban's teenage son isn't impressed, labeling the Kia a "nerd car." Cuban, a known critic of Elon Musk, has also playfully admitted to provoking Musk due to his perceived sensitivity.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests buying CAMS and Inox Wind. CAMS, after breaking consolidation, is expected to resume its uptrend with a target of Rs 4199. Inox Wind, having broken out of a bullish flag pattern, is also anticipated to continue its upward movement, targeting Rs 213.

title: Beyond qualification: PBKS batter shares Shreyas Iyer's blueprint
content: Shashank Singh tempered celebrations after Punjab Kings qualified for the playoffs, emphasizing that their ultimate goal, winning the championship on June 3rd, remains. He highlighted Shreyas Iyer's message that finishing in the top two is only half the battle. Despite Marco Jansen's departure, Shashank expressed confidence in the team's depth and multiple match-winners.

title: Big worry for MI: Historical hurdle awaits ahead of IPL 2025 Eliminator
content: Mumbai Indians' quest for a top-two IPL finish faltered after a loss to Punjab Kings, placing them fourth. Despite Suryakumar Yadav's stellar run and strong bowling, MI must now navigate the tougher Eliminator route. Historically, MI's titles have come when they finished in the top two, a feat they missed this season.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' students getting into college: World you entering will ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: Explained: Why Punjab Kings will get two chances to reach IPL 2025 final
content: Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in IPL 2025 after defeating Mumbai Indians, marking their first such achievement in 11 years. This victory grants them a crucial advantage: two opportunities to reach the final. Under coach Ricky Ponting and captain Shreyas Iyer, PBKS aim to capitalise on this second chance and pursue their inaugural IPL title.

title: Watch: Preity Zinta can't hold back emotions as Iyer seals Qualifier 1 spot
content: Co-owner Preity Zinta's exuberant celebration stole the show as Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in the IPL league stage. Skipper Shreyas Iyer's match-winning six against Mumbai Indians triggered Zinta's passionate outburst. The victory, fueled by Inglis and Arya's impressive partnership, gives Punjab Kings a crucial advantage in the playoffs.

title: ‚ÄòDraw your conclusions‚Äô: Jaishankar hints at China‚Äôs role in Pakistan conflict
content: External affairs minister Jaishankar asserted that India's military actions, not US mediation, compelled Pakistan to agree to a ceasefire. He criticized China's close defense ties with Pakistan and highlighted Pakistan's open support for terrorism. Jaishankar also addressed India's relationship with Russia, European double standards, and the progress of the India-EU Free Trade Agreement, expressing optimism about Indo-German defense cooperation.

title: Manipur stir forces governor to fly from airport to Raj Bhavan
content: Security forces in Imphal West halted a student and women-led rally heading to Raj Bhavan, protesting the concealment of 'Manipur' on a government bus. Tear gas was deployed to disperse the demonstrators who then formed a human chain. Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla, upon arrival, was escorted to Kangla Fort by helicopter due to the ongoing protests demanding an apology.

title: Basavaraju's death due to 'betrayal' by some in core formations: Naxals
content: CPI (Maoist) has accused insiders within its Maad-based formations, particularly PLGA Company No. 7, of betraying their chief Basavaraju, leading to his death in Narayanpur. The group's Dandakaranya Special Zonal Committee (DKSZC) cited compromised elements and surrenders for providing intelligence to the Chhattisgarh Police.

title: 'Sparkle for captaincy': Ponting hails Iyer as PBKS clinch top-two finish
content: Ricky Ponting lauded Shreyas Iyer's captaincy after Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish after the league stage, emphasising Iyer's leadership and the team's investment in him. Ponting acknowledged Marco Jansen's absence due to the WTC final but expressed confidence in the team's depth. He also praised young opener Priyansh Arya's impactful performance.

title: What is Reinke's edema, rare condition behind Miley Cyrus' iconic voice
content: Miley Cyrus revealed that her distinctive raspy voice is partly due to Reinke's edema, a vocal cord condition causing swelling. While she acknowledges it makes performing challenging, she credits the condition for contributing to her unique vocal tone and texture. Cyrus is hesitant about surgery, fearing it could alter her signature sound.

title: These 5 daily habits can prevent heart attacks!
content: Globally, heart disease remains a major killer. Dr. Vass, a New York emergency medicine expert, highlights five daily habits to significantly cut heart attack risk. These include post-meal walks to control blood sugar, prioritizing omega-3 intake for reduced inflammation, ensuring adequate sleep, swapping plastic for glass to avoid harmful chemicals, and regularly tracking advanced lab markers for early risk detection.

title: Kishore Kumar‚Äôs son Amit reveals he used to kick his 'mummy' Madhubala while sleeping
content: Legendary playback singer Kishore Kumar‚Äôs son, Amit Kumar, recently shared heartfelt recollections of his early years and the unique family dynamics that shaped his childhood. Amit spoke openly about his father‚Äôs marriages and his own bond with his stepmothers ‚Äî particularly the late actor Madhubala.

title: Person arrested on warrant needn't be told of reason: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has clarified that when an arrest is made with a warrant, a separate communication of the arrest grounds isn't required, as the warrant itself serves this purpose. The court stated that reading the warrant to the arrested person sufficiently informs them of the reasons for their arrest.

title: Did Swift just tease ‚ÄòReputation (Taylor‚Äôs Version)‚Äô? What fans think
content: Speculation is rampant that Taylor Swift might unveil Reputation (Taylor‚Äôs Version) at the 2025 American Music Awards. Although there's no official confirmation, fans are decoding clues, including a snake necklace at the iHeartRadio Music Awards and the use of "Look What You Made Me Do (Taylor‚Äôs Version)" in The Handmaid's Tale. Tiffany Haddish's presence at the AMAs further fuels anticipation.

title: ‚ÄòBhool chuk maaf‚Äô box office, day 4: Rajkummar Rao, Wamiqa Gabbi starrer witnesses dip
content: Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf,' a blend of comedy, drama, and time loop elements, has captivated audiences. The film, overcoming release hurdles, earned Rs 7 crore on its opening day and witnessed substantial growth over the weekend, crossing Rs. 30 crore in India after a 4-day run. Despite competition, the movie is maintaining a steady pace at the box office.

title: 'It's all pre-poll drama. I was beaten, starved... where was Lalu then?': Tej Pratap's wife
content: Aishwarya Rai, Tej Pratap Yadav's estranged wife, accuses Lalu Prasad's family of staging a drama by expelling their son from RJD amidst controversy over his alleged 12-year relationship. She claims the expulsion is a pre-election cover-up, alleging the family knew about the relationship all along. Aishwarya also recounts past abuse, stating the family used their influence to conceal it.

title: Odisha to seek trademark shield for Puri temple
content: Odisha government is seeking trademark rights for terms like 'Jagannath dham' and 'shree mandira' associated with Puri's Jagannath Temple, following a controversy over a temple in Digha using the name 'Jagannath dham'. Authorities aim to protect the religious and cultural significance of these terms, preventing unauthorized usage and potential legal challenges.

title: Triptii Dimri bags Vanga's Spirit for Rs 4 cr, far less than Deepika's fee: Report
content: Reports suggest that Deepika Padukone‚Äôs exit from Prabhas starrer Spirit stemmed from a series of disagreements with Sandeep Reddy Vanga. The Padmaavat actress had allegedly demanded over Rs 20 crore as remuneration, along with shorter working hours to accommodate her schedule as a new mother. According to reports, Triptii Dimri is being paid around Rs 4 crore for her role, significantly less than Deepika‚Äôs reported fee.

title: ED names Kerala CPM units laundering scam accused
content: The Enforcement Directorate has accused Kerala district units of the CPM in a money laundering case stemming from a ‚Çπ150 crore embezzlement at the Karuvannur Cooperative Bank, marking the second time a political entity has been named as an accused after AAP. Investigations revealed that local CPM units maintained undisclosed accounts with cooperative societies, holding significant balances and fixed deposits.

title: Cut deputation of IPS officers to CAPFs, boost cadre morale: SC
content: The Supreme Court has directed a phased reduction of IPS officers in CAPFs up to the IG rank over two years, aiming to improve promotion opportunities for cadre officers.

title: Bombay HC to hear today plea of student arrested for post on Op Sindoor
content: The Bombay High Court has postponed until Tuesday a hearing for interim bail sought by a Pune engineering student arrested over a social media post concerning Indo-Pak tensions during Operation Sindoor. The student, currently jailed in Yerwada, also challenges her college rustication as "arbitrary and unlawful.

title: Madhya Pradesh HC upholds sacking of judge who 'made cops and lawyers do squats'
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court validated the dismissal of a civil judge, Kaustubh Khera, who was accused of forcing lawyers and police to perform humiliating acts as a form of apology during contempt proceedings. The court emphasized that Khera's discharge was due to unsatisfactory performance, a decision made by the full court, and did not warrant interference.

title: NSA Doval down with seasonal flu, calls off his visit to Moscow
content: NSA Ajit Doval will not attend the 13th International Meeting of High Representatives for Security Issues in Moscow this week due to a seasonal flu. Despite his absence, he intends to advance bilateral security discussions with Russia soon. The event, chaired by Sergei Shoigu, has invited over 150 countries, including Pakistan, and various international organizations.

title: Bombay HC halts MIAL tender move on Celebi's plea
content: The Bombay High Court has temporarily halted Mumbai Airport's decision on bids to replace Celebi Airport Services' Indian arm for ground handling. This follows the revocation of Celebi's security clearance by BCAS due to security concerns. Celebi has challenged the revocation in both Delhi and Bombay High Courts. The stay remains until a regular bench reviews the challenge after reopening.

title: Desi system to make forecasts more accurate
content: India has launched its indigenous Bharat Forecast System (BFS), a high-resolution weather prediction model, enhancing spatial resolution to 6km. This advancement enables village-level forecasts, improving accuracy for extreme rainfall prediction by 30% and rainfall in the monsoon core zone by 64%. The BFS, developed by IITM-Pune, offers localized forecasts with unprecedented precision.

title: Result unchanged, but vote recount puts SC Bar Association under cloud
content: The Supreme Court intervened in the Supreme Court Bar Association (SCBA) election, ordering a recount of votes for the president's post due to challenges raised by various groups. Senior advocate Vikas Singh retained his position as president after the recount, although the vote tally for Adish Aggarwala decreased.

title: Indore witnesses 4 student suicides in 2 days
content: In Indore, a series of tragic suicides occurred over the weekend, claiming the lives of three students from nursing and science backgrounds, alongside a law student. Authorities suspect academic stress as a primary factor, with one nursing student leaving notes indicating depression and the inability to achieve her career aspirations.

title: 'Roti khao, varna meri goli to hai': PM Modi to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi launched a strong criticism against the Pakistani government and its army, accusing them of using terrorism for their own benefit. He urged the people of Pakistan to choose between peace and facing India's response to terror.

title: OSA charge on Nagpur woman who crossed LoC
content: Sunita Bholeshwar Jamgade, a 43-year-old woman from Nagpur, faces espionage charges after being detained in Pakistan for nine days. She illegally crossed the LoC in Kargil, Ladakh, to meet an online acquaintance. Pakistani Rangers handed her over to Indian authorities at the Attari border.

title: 'It's an exciting time to be part of space exploration': Peggy Whitson
content: Peggy Whitson, a veteran astronaut, highlights the evolution of spaceflight from government-led initiatives to commercial ventures like Axiom Space. She emphasizes the importance of physical and mental well-being during extended missions, along with international collaboration.

title: Quack brothers kill boy during botched surgery
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, two brothers with only a school education posed as surgeons, running an unlicensed hospital. Their deception led to tragedy when a six-year-old boy died following an operation to remove a surgical rod from his leg. Police arrested the brothers after an investigation revealed their lack of medical qualifications and reckless actions, driven by financial gain.

title: ‚ÄòPatriarchal, condescending‚Äô: Calcutta high court raps trial court judge
content: The Calcutta High Court overturned a lower court's divorce denial, criticizing the trial judge's "patriarchal and condescending" language towards women in matrimonial disputes. The High Court found the judge's advice on maintaining a successful marriage irrelevant to the legal matter. The court also cautioned the judge against "copy-pasting" orders, warning of potential impact on his service record if repeated.

title: Coast Guard, Kerala in race to stave off marine disaster
content: Following the sinking of the MSC ELSA 3 near Thottappally, a multi-pronged response has been initiated to mitigate potential marine pollution. Capital ships and a pollution response vessel have been deployed, while efforts are underway to salvage containers and address debris washing ashore.

title: Sourav Ganguly's brother, sister-in-law survive boat capsize
content: Cricket Association of Bengal president Snehasish Ganguly and his wife Arpita had a harrowing experience when their speedboat capsized near Puri's Light House beach due to a large wave. Lifeguards swiftly rescued the couple and three other tourists from the overturned vessel. Arpita Ganguly expressed her intent to appeal to Odisha's CM and Puri SP to improve safety regulations.

title: Taylor Swift fans panic over cryptic Instagram post after Travis Kelce date
content: Taylor Swift's Instagram activity has ignited a frenzy among fans, with some noticing a discrepancy in her post count, fueling speculation about a potential new album announcement. Meanwhile, Swift and Travis Kelce are reportedly distancing themselves from Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds due to a disagreement involving Justin Baldoni. Sources suggest Swift is relieved to end the friendship.

title: 'Balasaheb would've hugged Modi': Shah flays Uddhav for 'baraat' dig
content: Amit Shah strongly criticized Uddhav Thackeray's remarks about the all-party delegations, defending Operation Sindoor and asserting Balasaheb Thackeray would have supported PM Modi's actions. Shah emphasized the operation's success in sending a strong message to Pakistan and the world regarding India's resolve to protect its borders and citizens, highlighting the swift retaliation following terror attacks.

title: 'Dreams came true': Arsenal celebrate UWCL success
content: arsenal beat Barcelona 1-0 to win the women's champions league for the first time in 18 years . supporters gather in armoury square as early as 5 a.m. on monday to celebrate the end of an 18-year wait for a trophy . the victory parade did not start until after 10 .

title: Two-stop experiment doesn't fix F1's Monaco procession problem
content: formula 1's two-stop experiment at the Monaco Grand Prix underlines what the sport already knew about its most famous race . the confines of the circuit are too tight to allow genuine racing . it succeeded in providing a more dynamic race than the previous year, but with just one legal overtake in 78 laps, the fundamental issue with Monaco as an F1 venue was clear to see .

title: Woman hacked to death in Rajanna Sircilla district
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . a 60-year-old woman was hacked to death by a man . the woman was killed in a car crash in july .

title: Villa VAR fury, Modric and Ancelotti, Napoli win Serie A
content: we're almost at the end of the 2024-25 european club soccer season . this weekend gave us some unforgettable moments, big talking points and top-tier drama to discuss . aston villa clinched a second Serie A title in three seasons thanks to manager Antonio Conte and league MVP Scott McTominay .

title: Applications open for phase 2 of CM‚Äôs Green Fellowship Programme
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the latest phasing of the second fad has been launched in the u.s. . edudu government has launched the second phase of the government's phashing of the first phase .

title: Final 2025 men's recruiting class rankings: 4 new teams, plus risers and fallers
content: the 2025 men's basketball recruiting class was missing star power in march . the last update in January saw multiple five-star prospects make commitments . a.J. Dybantsa and niko Bundalo traded buckets in the second quarter .

title: How the Hurricanes stayed alive and what's ahead for Game 5 with Florida
content: the Carolina Hurricanes beat the canes 3-0 in the Eastern Conference finals . the Panthers faced their share of questions centered around how they would perform knowing they were a loss away from their season ending . there's at least one more contest to london on friday .

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . a leopard was spotted on the first ghat road leading to a swarm of leopards . the leopard is spotted in the swansea . it is the first leopard to be seen on the road leading the way .
